meanings.definition: To build or set up again
meanings.sent1: After the storm, they reerected their tent for shelter.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew reerected the fallen fence.
meanings.sent3: The toy blocks were reerected by the child in a funny pattern.
meanings.sent4: She reerected her confidence after the setback.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins were reerected in the virtual reality simulation.

meanings.definition: To restore to an upright position
meanings.sent1: The kind stranger helped reerect the fallen signpost.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to reerect the fallen flagpole.
meanings.sent3: The strong wind kept reerecting the umbrella, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: His words reerected her spirits like a beacon of hope.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor guided her to reerect her posture for better balance.
